content.prompt: Which of the following best describes an overall trend in the data?

choices.label: Disputes and quarrels made up approximately half of offenses in both periods, while the percentage of behavioral and ecclesiastical offenses changed significantly.
Disputes and quarrels made up approximately half of offenses in both periods, while the other categories of offenses also showed little change.
Marriage and sexual misconduct offenses remained a majority of the recorded offenses in both periods.
Overall, the number of offenses decreased significantly from the first period to the second period.

skill.text: Skill 5.A: Identify patterns among or connections between historical developments and processes.
